meanings.definition: behave in a way that is intended to impress or mislead others
meanings.sent1: She was posturing to seem more confident than she really was.
meanings.sent2: The politician was posturing during the debate to gain support.
meanings.sent3: The cat was posturing as if it were the king of the house.
meanings.sent4: The actor was posturing on stage, trying to convince the audience of his character.
meanings.sent5: The peacock was posturing proudly, showing off its colorful feathers.

meanings.definition: the way in which someone stands or sits, especially when deliberately trying to create a particular impression
meanings.sent1: His posturing in front of the mirror showed his attempt to look taller.
meanings.sent2: Her elegant posturing at the party caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The dog's posturing with a toy in its mouth made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The tree's posturing in the wind made it look like a dancing giant.
meanings.sent5: The model's posturing on the runway was graceful and confident.
